entries.title: Biden Calls for Limiting Tech Companies' Use of Personal Data, Targeted Advertising
entries.description: Both parties have criticized social-media companies but differ on some issues.

entries.title: Alphabet Unit Verily to Trim More Than 200 Jobs
entries.description: Verily Life Sciences is laying off the employees as part of a broader reorganization, the first major staff reductions to hit Google’s parent following a wave of other tech layoffs.

entries.title: FTX Says It Has Located More Than $5 Billion in Cash, Liquid Assets
entries.description: The bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange said it has located more than $5 billion in cash and other liquid assets and is hoping to sell additional assets with a book value of more than $4 billion.

entries.title: Inside Bankman-Fried's $1 Billion Bet on a Kazakh Bitcoin Miner
entries.description: Genesis Digital, rigged to consume a small city’s worth of electricity in Kazhakstan, is one of the largest assets in the FTX-Alameda wreckage. Extracting value from it could prove difficult.

entries.title: Mouse Jigglers, Fake PowerPoints: Workers Foil Bosses' Surveillance Attempts
entries.description: Companies that track employees’ productivity run up against their inventive workarounds. A live stream called Sloth TV.

entries.title: It's Not Just You: 5G Is a Big Letdown
entries.description: The newest network won’t change how you use your phone—but you can still make the most of it.

entries.title: Google Accused of Violating Germany's Digital-Competition Law
entries.description: The competition regulator said tech giant doesn’t give users sufficient choice about how it combines data from its various services, a sign of things to come under a new EU law.

entries.title: Apple Needs to Take Its Time With Augmented Reality
entries.description: A sluggish year ahead might compel the launch of a new product category, but AR is far from a sure thing.

entries.title: U.S. Solar Manufacturing to Get $2.5 Billion Investment From South Korean Conglomerate
entries.description: Hanwha Group’s Qcells plans one of the biggest solar investments in the U.S., the latest example of a rush of money spurred by tax incentives.

entries.title: Tesla Considers $775 Million Texas Factory Expansion
entries.description: The auto maker’s plans include new construction projects related to car and battery-cell operations.
